intro: Calonemorchis stricta, commonly known as the slender calonemorchis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with intricate patterns on the petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
